title: 4 Simple Ways to Delete a Snap You Sent on Snapchat

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. It's a yellow-and-white ghost icon on your Home screen or in your app list. Snaps are automatically deleted from your story after 24 hours. [1] X Research source If you don't see the Snap you're looking for, it's already been deleted.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. This is in the top-left corner. You may see your Bitmoji instead.

steps.title: Tap your Story.
steps.content: Tap your Story. This is under the My Stories header.

steps.title: Swipe up on the Snap.
steps.content: Swipe up on the Snap. If there are multiple Snaps in your Story, tap the right side of the screen to skip to the one you want to delete. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the trash can icon.
steps.content: Tap the trash can icon. You can find this at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . The Snap will be deleted from your Story.

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. It's a yellow-and-white ghost icon on your Home screen or in your app list. If a Snap is set to Never Delete , users can save a Snap by long-pressing the Snap while viewing a Snap (or directly after viewing). Saved Snaps will appear in the Chat Media section. Use this method to delete any Snap you sent within a chat. All unopened Snaps may be kept for up to 60 days after they've been sent.

steps.title: Swipe right to open the Chat screen.
steps.content: Swipe right to open the Chat screen. This displays all of your conversations.

steps.title: Tap the chat with the Snap you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap the chat with the Snap you want to delete. You can delete a Snap from a chat with one person or a group chat. The other people in the chat will be able to see that you've deleted a Snap, although they will no longer be able to view the Snap itself. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap and hold the Snap.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Snap. A pop-up menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This is at the bottom, near the trash can icon.

steps.title: Tap Delete again.
steps.content: Tap Delete again. This deletes the Snap from the conversation and Snapchat's servers. If someone saved the Snap to the chat as Chat Media, it will be removed from there as well. Keep in mind that some Snaps may show briefly on other devices due to unstable internet connections or older versions of the app.

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. It's a yellow-and-white ghost icon on your Home screen or in your app list.

steps.title: Tap the two-overlapping rectangles.
steps.content: Tap the two-overlapping rectangles. This is at the bottom-left corner of the screen. Your Memories will open. You can also swipe up on the screen.

steps.title: Long-press the Snap you want to delete.
steps.content: Long-press the Snap you want to delete. You can scroll down to view your Snaps, or you can use the search bar at the top to search for keywords or dates. Icons will appear at the bottom of the screen. If you want to select multiple, tap the Snaps so the blue checkmark appears in the bottom-right corner of each Snap.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This is under the trash can icon.

steps.title: Tap Delete Snap.
steps.content: Tap Delete Snap . If you're deleting more than one, you'll see "Delete [number] Snaps" instead. The Snaps will be deleted from your Memories. If needed, you can recover deleted Memories by submitting an official request.

steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat. It's a yellow-and-white ghost icon on your Home screen or in your app list. Use this method to delete Snaps you've submitted to Spotlight or have saved to the Snap Map.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It's at the top-left corner of the screen. This opens your profile. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down to the "Spotlight & Snap Map" section.
steps.content: Scroll down to the "Spotlight & Snap Map" section. This is between Communities and My Favorites .

steps.title: Tap and hold the Snap you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Snap you want to delete. This will be listed underneath Spotlight & Snap Map .

steps.title: Tap Delete Snap.
steps.content: Tap Delete Snap . This is by the trash can icon. The Snap will be deleted from the Spotlight.
